node.title: 'My son's the police minister. I'm pissed': Kenneth Grant found guilty of deadly 'sleepwalking' hit-run
node.description: The former police officer's defence over the hit-and-run death of a man was that he was sleepwalking and not conscious of his actions at the time. Today, a judge rejected that argument.
node.content:
["Kenneth Wayne Grant's defence of his involvement in a fatal hit-and-run in 2019, was that he was sleepwalking at the time, and unaware he was driving his ute when it struck and killed scientist Tony Greenfield.\u00a0", "Today that defence was meticulously pulled apart by Newcastle District Court Judge John Hatzistergos and Grant \u2014 the father of former NSW police minister Troy Grant \u2014 was found guilty of three charges stemming from the death of Mr Greenfield.", "Grant's defence team had told the court\u00a0that he had fallen asleep at a Christmas party, which\u00a0he and Mr Greenfield had both attended near Maitland on November 30, 2019.", "Despite being weary and intoxicated, the court heard Grant left the party around 11.25pm\u00a0to drive home in his ute.", "Minutes\u00a0later, several hundred metres down the road, the vehicle hit and killed Mr Greenfield, 62.", "Grant's barrister, Phillip Boulten, told the court\u00a0that the former police officer had no memory of the incident that killed Mr Greenfield, a highly respected NSW Health scientist, and that he was involuntarily driving at the\u00a0time.", "Grant had\u00a0pleaded not guilty to dangerous driving occasioning death, failing to stop and assist after a vehicle impact causing death, and not stopping during a police pursuit.", "However,\u00a0Judge Hatzistergos rejected the sleepwalking defence and found Grant guilty of all three counts, saying \"there was no reasonable possibility the accused was sleepwalking at the time\".", "\"The accused's answers are consistent with a conscious and voluntary decision to drive.\"", "", "
Former NSW police minister Troy Grant with his father Kenneth, centre, after an earlier court appearance.(AAP Image: Joel Carrett)
", "
'Silly me, I\u00a0made a mistake'
", "Grant's trial heard that after he struck Mr Greenfield, Grant was pursued by police under lights and sirens, before he finally stopped\u00a0his ute\u00a0and spoke\u00a0to arresting officers.\u00a0", "At that point, crown prosecutor Lee Carr told the court, Grant outlined\u00a0his family connections as well as the intoxicated state he was in.", "A police body camera recorded Grant's conversation with an arresting officer.", "\"The accused is [then]\u00a0reported to have stated, 'Silly me, I made a mistake,' words to that effect.\"", "Troy Grant was the police minister between 2017 and 2019, but had left the position eight months before his father's deadly crash.", "
'Can something be done?'
", "Grant, who had a blood alcohol level of 0.194, was taken to Maitland police station to be tested again.\u00a0", "\"Subsequent to that test, he was clearly found over the limit, and he is asking whether something can be done about it,\" Mr Carr told the court.", "Grant senior never denied he was drunk on the night of the incident, but said he had\u00a0no memory of the hit-and-run and that it was an involuntary act.", "", "
Grant was found guilty on all three counts in the Newcastle District Court.\u00a0(ABC Newcastle: Robert Virtue)
", "
The sleepwalking defence
", "Evidence given by medical experts was\u00a0the key focus in Grant's trial.", "A sleep expert relied on by the prosecution, Dr Anup Desai, told the court there was no evidence that Grant\u00a0had fallen asleep at the party before leaving and getting behind the wheel of his\u00a0ute.", "He then testified that, in his professional opinion, sleepwalkers could not drive a car \u2014 or at least not drive a significant distance \u2014 without crashing.", "But the defence argued Grant's decision to drive was \"involuntary\"\u00a0because he could have been sleepwalking or experiencing sleep apnoea at the time.", "In his evidence at trial, Troy Grant said his father's sleepwalking was the stuff of \"folklore\" within his family.", "In the end, it was up to former state attorney-general,\u00a0presiding Judge Hatzistergos, to decide.", "\"Guilty,\" he said to all three counts.", "Grant remains on bail and will be sentenced at a later date."]
